thread.title: Competition terms and conditions: Michelin
thread.title_full: Competition terms and conditions: Michelin - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Competition terms and conditions: Michelin
text: Feeling adventurous? Embark on a Great British Drive » 1. This competition is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years over, except for employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited (“Promoter”) and Michelin Tyre Plc, their agents or anyone else professionally associated with the competition. 2. All information detailing how to enter this competition forms part of these terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. Submission of an entry will be taken to mean acceptance of these terms and conditions. 3. To enter this competition, participants must submit their entry to www.telegraph.co.uk/greatbritishdrives. Once submitted, the Promoter cannot accept any amends to any part of an entry. 4. All entries must be received by midnight on 30 October 2015. 5. All entries submitted must be the work of the individual submitting them and must not have been published elsewhere or have won a prize in any other competition. It is the responsibility of each entrant to ensure that their entry does not infringe the copyright of any third party or any laws. 6. Copyright in all entries submitted for this competition remains with the respective entrants. However, each Michelin Tyres Plc to feature any or all of the submitted entries in any of their publications, their websites and/or in any promotional material connected to this competition. Entrants will not receive remittance for such publication, though their work will be credited. 7. Only one entry per person. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of transmission or posting will not be accepted as proof of receipt. Entries must not be sent through agencies or third parties. 8. One winning entry will be selected by a panel of experts at the Telegraph. The names of the judges are to be confirmed. The panel of experts will judge entries on the best description of an interesting or novel drive. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 9. The winning entrant and the nine runners up shall win: • A driving kit, including: a scraper glove; digital pressure gauge; tyre tread depth gauge; a torch; a thermal mug; a fleece blanket; and a holdall. 10. The winner’s name shall feature in the Discovery section of The Sunday Telegraph on 13 December 2015. The size of the feature will be decided by the Promoter. A photo of the winner may feature alongside the winner’s name, with the prior consent of the winner. 11. The winner and runners up shall be notified within 14 days of the closing date of the competition. 12. In the event of the Promoter being unable to contact the overall winner or runners up within 48 hours to arrange fulfilment of the prize or if the winner or runners up are unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to another entrant who, in the opinion of the judges and in accordance with these terms and conditions, is the next best entry. 13. The winner’s may be required to take part in publicity. 14. The winner’s name and county may be disclosed to anyone who writes within one month after the published closing date, enclosing a stamped addressed envelope, to Great British Drive Winner, Spark, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. 15. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. The prize is non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 16. Events may occur that render the competition itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the competition. All other facilities connected with the provision of the prize are the responsibility of Michelin Tyres Plc. Promoter Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London, SW1W 0DT.
